items.message: At St Johns water levels in the Monktonmead continue to fall. In total 32mm of rain was recorded at Ryde rain gauge over 2 hours between 5:45 and 07:45 although most fell in just 1 hour. For the remainder of today (Monday 2/08/2021) it is possible that some further heavy showers could affect the Isle of Wight, although the likelihood is very low. The forecast for the rest of the week is also predicting heavy showers with Wednesday and Thursday having the highest risk of intense storms. By the nature of such events it is not possible to be precise with location and timings. If more heavy rain does affect the river then we may have to issue further advice.

At St Johns water levels in the Monktonmead continue to fall. In total 32mm of rain was recorded at Ryde rain gauge over 2 hours between 5:45 and 07:45 although most fell in just 1 hour. For the remainder of today (Monday 2/08/2021) it is possible that some further heavy showers could affect the Isle of Wight, although the likelihood is very low. The forecast for the rest of the week is also predicting heavy showers with Wednesday and Thursday having the highest risk of intense storms. By the nature of such events it is not possible to be precise with location and timings. If more heavy rain does affect the river then we may have to issue further advice.

River levels in the Uck have now fallen from their peak and are nearing normal levels. Monday morning should be relatively dry and so the river should return to normal this afternoon (02/08/2021). Flood impacts will ease, but small amounts of water may remain in fields, gardens and on rural roads. However, further showers which could be intense, are forecast for Tuesday (03/08/2021) and the rest of the week. If the more intense rain falls this week on the River Uck, the risk of flooding could return. Please remain prepared for further potential periods of flood risk. We will continue to monitor the levels and forecast. We will reissue this message if the risk of flooding increases.

The River Uck at Buxted has fallen overnight and is now nearing normal levels. Monday morning should be relatively dry and so the river should return to normal this afternoon (02/08/2021). Flood impacts will ease, but small amounts of water may remain in fields, gardens and on rural roads. No new property flooding is expected. However, further showers which could be intense, are forecast for Tuesday (03/08/2021) and the rest of the week. If the more intense rain falls this week on the River Uck, the risk of flooding could return. Please take care around flood water and avoid driving through it. We will reissue this message if the river level rises and the risk of flooding returns.
